events.event_description: U.S. nuclear generators used 32 million pounds of imported uranium concentrate and only 0.05 million pounds of domestic U3O8, with imports accounting for 99% of uranium used.
events.citation: In 2023, U.S. nuclear generators used 32 million pounds of imported uranium concentrate (U3O8) and only 0.05 million pounds of domestically produced U3O8. Imports accounted for 99% of the U3O8 they used in 2023 to make nuclear fuel.

events.event_description: The U.S. Department of Energy received $2.7 billion in congressional funding to help revive domestic fuel production for commercial nuclear power plants.
events.citation: The U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) recently received $2.7 billion in congressional funding to help revive domestic fuel production for commercial nuclear power plants.

events.event_description: U.S. production of U3O8 increased 24% to 121,296 pounds in Q3 2024 from 97,709 pounds in Q2 2024, with production occurring at five facilities in Wyoming and Texas.
events.citation: U.S. production of U3O8 in the third quarter of 2024 totaled 121,296 pounds, a 24% increase from production of 97,709 pounds in the second quarter. Production in the third quarter occurred at five U.S. facilities: three in Wyoming (Nichols Ranch ISR Project, Lost Creek Project, and Smith Ranch-Highland Operation) and two in Texas (Alta Mesa Project and Rosita).

events.event_description: The United States banned imports of uranium products from Russia, with companies allowed to apply for waivers through January 1, 2028.
events.citation: In May 2024, the United States banned imports of uranium products from Russia beginning in August, although companies may apply for waivers through January 1, 2028.
